Masterworks: Velocity

Uzume RR4 returns to us with some interesting rolls. Fourth Time's the Charm and Vorpal Weapon are going to be your best neutral and solo picks. Golden Tricorn on Solar might be fun for short damage cycles. Precision Instrument is the worst damage perk of the three for me but pairs really well with Fourth Time's the Charm for all the precision hits. Either way you slice it, having a magazine boosting perk is a requirement.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

In PvP things have shifted a bit, Explosive Payload feels like you have a better hitbox, but doesn't actually provide any benefits other than shooting the floor for some splash damage. Vorpal Weapon allows you to one shot any super, which is helpful for Trials rounds or general PvP super fights. Snapshot Sights and as much handling as you can invest will make this sniper feel extremely strong.
Masterworks: Handling

Uzume RR4 returns to us with some interesting rolls. Fourth Time's the Charm and Vorpal Weapon are going to be your best neutral and solo picks. Golden Tricorn on Solar might be fun for short damage cycles. Precision Instrument is the worst damage perk of the three for me but pairs really well with Fourth Time's the Charm for all the precision hits. Either way you slice it, having a magazine boosting perk is a requirement.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

In PvP things have shifted a bit, Explosive Payload feels like you have a better hitbox, but doesn't actually provide any benefits other than shooting the floor for some splash damage. Vorpal Weapon allows you to one shot any super, which is helpful for Trials rounds or general PvP super fights. Snapshot Sights and as much handling as you can invest will make this sniper feel extremely strong.
Masterworks: Handling

I'm happy for more variants of weapons. Vengeful Whisper being a strand bow opens up some loadout flexibility and covers your strand subclass verbs. It's less useful without Match Game but it can still be useful for taking out shields faster. Archer's Tempo is fantastic on bows for lowering successive draw times, and Precision Instrument fits nicely as you'll want to hit those crits, the draw time allowing you a bit of forgiveness lining up those crit shots. You could even switch it up and go with Explosive Payload and Successful Warm-Up if you're using this in lower and PvE where you can one shot everything to keep Successful Warm-Up going.
Masterworks: Draw Time

In the crucible I don't think you'll find as much success. Vengeful Whisper does have Explosive Head for better flinch and AoE but I find bow swapping a bit easier with a handling perk like Shot Swap or even Perpetual Motion. If you're not bow swapping I prefer Archer's Tempo or Rapid Hit for better follow up shots. Successful Warm-Up is great but only works after your first kill.
Masterworks: Draw Time

Vouchsafe returns but has lost a bit of its edge. It used to be a really good void scout, comparable to Night Watch. And while Night Watch has still kept some of its relevance over the years, Doom of Chelchis has overtaken Vouchsafe for the best in slot weapon. Vouchsafe does retain some great perks in Rapid Hit and Explosive Payload, while also adding in great perks like Repulsor Brace and Golden Tricorn. It might not be the ultimate best weapon, but it also doesn't require any raiding.
Masterworks: Stability

Lightweight frames in PvP are in an interesting spot. They don't kill fast enough to be competitive, and any boosts don't really elevate the weapon further. Golden Tricorn 2x does allow you to 3 shot any guardian at any resilience at a 0.60 TtK, but it requires two whole kills to get rolling and without additional ability kills you'll be back at square one before you know it. Taraxippos and Eternal Blazon with Kill Clip or even Tarnished Mettle with Swashbuckler allow you to 3 crit after just one kill.
Masterworks: Handling

Let's talk about power creep. When Waking Vigil released it was a phenomenal arc hand cannon. Outclassed by Nation of Beasts for the best arc hand cannon. With its midlife refresh Waking Vigil was blessed with a reload perk and an AoE perk through Dragonfly. However it was still overshadowed by Nation of Beasts and by then Ancient Gospel. When the hand cannon merger happened, Waking Vigil lost its only claim to fame being a Lightweight hand cannon versus the aforementioned adaptives. While we still have some great perks going on currently, Waking Vigil is just a relic from the past.
Masterworks: Handling

Waking Vigil used to be one of the most coveted energy hand cannons. A slimline model, access to Rangefinder and Opening Shot together to have an energy Dire Promise. Current form is a little less than stellar due to the lack of Slideshot, but it still retains the OG roll if you still care about Rangefinder.
Masterworks: Range

Whisper is back and craftable. What seems to be the best perks for our dear friend Xol, Will of Thousands? Arrowhead Brake is the best in slot for making the recoil direction vertical, but if you don't need that, Corkscrew Rifling or Fluted Barrel for the added stats. Bungie decided against magazine extending perks so the best here is Flared Magwell for when you miss and need to reload. Alloy Mag is great if you do run out of ammo and need to reload before another boss fight or after a wipe. In the third column Field Prep brings up the already buffed reserves while also making reloading faster when crouched. The final column are the stocks and Short-Action Stock is the best for the added handling, if you didn't slot in Arrowhead Brake and still want the recoil direction bumped up you could instead go for Fitted Stock.
Masterworks:

If you wanted to take Whisper into PvP bump up the handling via Fluted Barrel and Short-Action Stock. Field Prep also gives a handling bonus when crouched and Accurized Rounds will also bump up your range.
Masterworks:

I am glad to see more obtainable double-fire grenade launchers. Wilderflight is great, but being locked behind a dungeon means most players won't even see it drop. Being a Vanguard reward allows more players to obtain it, and I love that as the double-fire is a very fun and interesting option within our ever-expanding arsenal. For PvE you're looking for the tried and true Envious Assassin, this paired with Incandescent will clear rooms and deal some great damage against bosses. Unrelenting is a great option if you're committing to using Wild Style as your main weapon, the extra healing plus synergy with Solar verbs will make you unkillable.
Masterworks: Blast Radius

Wild Style and by extension all double-fire grenade launchers have one limiting factor, and that is that it fires two shots at once. If your one grenade bounces away you lose half your damage. With Bungie's architecture it happens more often than not. Disorienting Grenades will allow you to still blind even if one goes away, and High-Velocity Rounds will keep your arc tighter to make bounces less punishing (if you're not purposefully bouncing shots).
Masterworks: Blast Radius

Cold Steel is Zephyr's claim to fame. Zephyr is the only sword with Cold Steel and you'll want to stack as many charge time benefits as possible. Duelist's Trance grants +60 to charge rate and both Guard Resistance and Endurance. This all allows you to heavy swing more frequently. Stacking the extra slow debuff faster. Tempered Edge also gives you more ammo while adding more impact as well. Dealing better damage is always good.
Masterworks: Impact

Zephyr was one of my favorite swords when it was introduced in season 2. I still think it looks incredible. In PvP you'll want some good guard resistance so you can get close and if you happen to have multiple enemies stacked up you can get Chain Reaction kills. More booms equals better, no?
Masterworks: Impact
